description: Researchers found diagnosis rates varied depending on location — with parts of the Great Plains and Southwest seeing fewer dementia cases than predicted.
title: A new Alzheimer's study suggests where you live can affect the odds of a diagnosis

description: Monday marks a rare cosmic event: a blue supermoon. It’s a combination of a supermoon, when it’s closest to Earth, and a blue moon, which is the third of four full moons in a season.
title: Here's why tonight's blue supermoon is so special

description: Ukraine is fighting Russia on three separate fronts: a recent incursion into Russia, an ongoing slugfest in eastern Ukraine and naval skirmishes in the Black Sea. We look at how all three are going.
title: How Ukraine's three fronts on Russia are playing out

description: Former President Trump and his running mate, JD Vance, are barnstorming key swing states. Meanwhile, his surrogates are in Chicago meeting with reporters on his behalf.
title: Trump's counterprogramming plans during the DNC

description: United States Secretary of State Antony Blinken is in Israel pushing for a cease-fire in Gaza as soon as possible.
title: The latest on Blinken's cease-fire negotiations in Israel

description: Some 524 people, including the ship’s captain, perished when the HMS Hawke went down in the North Sea off the eastern coast of Scotland in 1914.
title: Explorers say they’ve found a British warship sunk by a German U-boat in WWI

description: NPR’s Ailsa Chang talks with Nahid Islam, one of the Bangladeshi student protesters who is now serving as a minister of the country's interim government after their former prime minister fled.
title: He was recently leading Bangladeshi student protests. Now he's a government minister.

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Bloomberg News' Madison Muller, who reported on a Kentucky city that has one of the highest concentrations of people with weight loss drug prescriptions in the country.
title: Ozempic takes over the Kentucky city of Bowling Green

description: Democrats are drawing attention to Project 2025 for Trump's second term for their own political gain. The party took an obscure document and turned it into a household name.
title: How Dems learned to love Project 2025

description: A coalition of demonstrators in support of the Palestinian cause are protesting outside of the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.
title: Pro-Palestinian protestors demonstrate outside of the DNC in Chicago

description: Milwaukee delegates head to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. This DNC is drawing comparisons to the campaign that launched Barack Obama’s presidency.
title: Obama's campaign echoes as Milwaukee delegates go to the DNC

description: President Biden is set to headline Monday night's programming, but convention planning remains in flux with the party's quick pivot to Vice President Harris as the nominee.
title: Here’s who’s expected to speak on Day 1 of the DNC

description: House Republicans allege abuse of power and obstruction of justice in son Hunter Biden's financial dealings. But the investigation stops short of alleging any criminal wrongdoing by the president.
title: House Republicans release impeachment report on Biden but next steps are uncertain

description: The broadcaster was hailed as the father of the modern audience-participation daytime talk show. Donahue's taste for controversial and polarizing subjects birthed a new genre of television.
title: Pioneer talk show host Phil Donahue dies at 88

description: Some 12 million people are displaced in Sudan as the military government battles a powerful paramilitary group. There is acute hunger and risk of famine for many. Peace talks hoping to resolve the crisis are being held in Geneva this week. We hear about the chances that those talks will succeed and details about conditions on the ground in Sudan.
title: The Urgency of the Situation in Sudan

description: Derrick Johnson, who is expected to speak Monday night at the DNC, says young Black voters in particular are more excited about the election with Vice President Harris as the nominee.
title: NAACP president tells NPR his eye is on the campaigns’ economic proposals

description: Clinical psychologist Talal Alsaleem has helped hundreds of couples work through romantic affairs. He shares common misconceptions about cheating -- and how to cope.
title: Once a cheater, always a cheater? Busting 3 common myths about infidelity

description: President Biden had made a career of digging in and proving the doubters wrong — until he finally met a political crisis he couldn’t ride out.
title: This was supposed to be Biden's convention. Instead, tonight, he's the opening act

description: The DNC kicks off today in Chicago with Biden as the keynote speaker. Here's what to expect at the convention. And, Trump plans to steal the spotlight this week with a number of rallies planned.
title: DNC kickoff: what to expect and Trump's plan to steal spotlight

description: Ukraine's incursion into Russia opens a third front that Kyiv is counting on to build leverage and morale. NPR's A Martinez talks with the Financial Times' Ukraine correspondent Christopher Miller.
title: Ukraine is now fighting Russia on 3 separate fronts

description: The 1921 Tulsa race riots began after a Black man was accused of assaulting a white woman. The case was later dismissed in court, but historians estimate that up to 300 people died during the riots.
title: 3 more sets of remains tied to the 1921 Tulsa race riots found with gunshot wounds

description: Security and semiconductors are among Taiwan's priorities, as the island considers the presidential candidates' policies and possible impacts on the island, which China repeatedly threatens to invade.
title: Here's why Taiwan is watching the U.S. election closely

description: As Illinois hosts the Democratic convention in Chicago, the issue of abortion — and the state’s role as a hub for patients seeking the procedure — will be on display.
title: As Democrats meet in Chicago, Illinois' role in abortion access is in the spotlight

description: Nonprofit hospitals pay their CEOs generously, and their compensation keeps getting larger. Some researchers wonder if the ballooning paychecks align with what’s best for patients and taxpayers.
title: CEOs earn big bucks at nonprofit hospitals. But does that benefit patients?

description: Julia Weber was walking home from work one day in San Francisco when an earthquake struck. She rode it out in the arms of a stranger.
title: When an earthquake struck in 1989, Julia locked eyes with a stranger and embraced

description: The number of people coming into the U.S. from Canada continues to increase.  We visit border communities in New York, where the response to migrants is mixed.
title: Northern border communities face a dramatic increase in illegal crossings

description: The Trump campaign is hoping to draw some attention to the GOP candidate, and is speaking out against the Harris-Walz campaign in Pennsylvania.
title: Trump puts together swing state events to counter Harris polling surge

description: Nearly 35 years after the Americans with Disabilities Act was signed, many curb ramps and sidewalks are still not suitable for wheelchairs. An Indiana program helps children navigate these obstacles.
title: Indiana program aims to help children in wheelchairs overcome sidewalk obstacles

description: President Biden's Democratic convention speech is expected to build a bridge to Vice President Harris. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to ex-White House chief of staff and Biden confidante Ron Klain.
title: Biden's speech, cornerstone for the Democratic convention, will open festivities

description: Vice President Harris, Gov. Walz and their spouses travel through Pennsylvania by bus on their way to the Democratic National Convention. NPR is along for the ride.
title: Harris-Walz team campaigns in Pennsylvania in a lead-up to the convention

description: America's only native bamboo was once plentiful along river banks, before making way for agriculture.  Now it's a rare plant, and there are efforts to bring it back.
title: A group in southwest Virginia is working to restore bamboo that's native to the U.S.

description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is warning of yet another respiratory virus in the back-to-school season. The virus is associated with a facial rash in children.
title: A surge in the human parvovirus has caught the attention of the CDC

description: Law enforcement in Chicago trained for worst-case scenarios at the DNC. Three thousand officers trained on mass-arrests, and a court has been revived to rapidly process up to 90 people at a time.
title: Chicago police will support peaceful protests but say they're prepared for trouble

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is trying to get a cease-fire agreement for Gaza “across the finish line.” It has been on the table for months, and many are skeptical a deal can be reached.
title: Blinken is in Israel trying to arrange a cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas

description: The next three supermoons will be Sept. 18, Oct. 17, and Nov. 15.
title: Monday night's supermoon is the first of 4 supermoons in a row

description: A collection agency sought court authority to garnish a patient’s wages to pay a disputed surgery bill. But after the patient showed up in court to explain why the bill was bogus, the judge declined to let the bill collector seize her money.
title: Bill of the Month: On the surgical table only once but billed for 2 operations
